conclusion: Understand the relationship between the light source, objects, and shadows.
Identify the objects: typewriter, clock, egg, and domino. Shadows are labeled A, B, C, and D.
The light source is positioned to cast shadows on the ground.
If the light source moves to the back left or right, the shadows will shift accordingly.
If the light source moves to the back left, the shadow of the clock will move to the back right.
If the light source moves to the back right, the shadow of the clock will move to the back left.
The shadows of the typewriter, egg, and domino will remain in the same position relative to the light source.
The shadows of the objects will adjust based on the new position of the light source.
The shadow of the clock will move to the back right when the light source moves to the back left. The shadow of the clock will move to the back left when the light source moves to the back right.
